  129: -define(SLEEP, 500).
  130: -define(CORRECT_PASSWORD, "hello test").
  131: -define(INCORRECT_PASSWORD, "hello").
  132: -define(BADARG_PASSWORD, hello).

  134: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  135: %% Common Test interface functions -----------------------------------
  136: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  137: 
  138: all() ->
  139:     [
  140:      {group, 'tlsv1.3'},
  141:      {group, 'tlsv1.2'},
  142:      {group, 'tlsv1.1'},
  143:      {group, 'tlsv1'}
  144:     ].
  145: 
  146: groups() ->
  147:     [
  148:      {'tlsv1.3', [],  (api_tests() ++  [tls_13_reject_change_cipher_spec_as_first_msg,
  149:                                         tls_13_middlebox_reject_change_cipher_spec_as_first_msg]) -- [sockname]},
  150:      {'tlsv1.2', [],  api_tests()},
  151:      {'tlsv1.1', [],  api_tests()},
  152:      {'tlsv1', [],  api_tests()}
  153:     ].
  154: 
  155: api_tests() ->
  156:     [
  157:      tls_upgrade,
  158:      tls_upgrade_new_opts,
  159:      tls_upgrade_new_opts_with_sni_fun,
  160:      tls_upgrade_with_timeout,
  161:      tls_upgrade_with_client_timeout,
  162:      tls_downgrade,
  163:      tls_shutdown,
  164:      tls_shutdown_write,
  165:      tls_shutdown_both,
  166:      tls_shutdown_error,
  167:      tls_password_correct,
  168:      tls_password_incorrect,
  169:      tls_password_badarg,
  170:      tls_client_closes_socket,
  171:      tls_closed_in_active_once,
  172:      tls_reset_in_active_once,
  173:      tls_monitor_listener,
  174:      tls_tcp_msg,
  175:      tls_tcp_msg_big,
  176:      tls_dont_crash_on_handshake_garbage,
  177:      tls_tcp_error_propagation_in_active_mode,
  178:      tls_reject_warning_alert_in_initial_hs,
  179:      tls_reject_fake_warning_alert_in_initial_hs,
  180:      tls_app_data_in_initial_hs_state,
  181:      peername,
  182:      sockname,
  183:      tls_server_handshake_timeout,
  184:      transport_close,
  185:      transport_close_in_inital_hello,
  186:      emulated_options,
  187:      accept_pool,
  188:      reuseaddr
  189:     ].
  190: 
  191: init_per_suite(Config0) ->
  192:     catch crypto:stop(),
  193:     try crypto:start() of
  194: 	ok ->
  195: 	    ssl_test_lib:clean_start(),
  196: 	    ssl_test_lib:make_rsa_cert_with_protected_keyfile(Config0,
  197:                                                               ?CORRECT_PASSWORD)
  198:     catch _:_ ->
  199: 	    {skip, "Crypto did not start"}
  200:     end.
  201: 
  202: end_per_suite(_Config) ->
  203:     ssl:stop(),
  204:     application:unload(ssl),
  205:     application:stop(crypto).
  206: 
  207: init_per_group(GroupName, Config) ->
  208:     ssl_test_lib:init_per_group(GroupName, Config).
  209: 
  210: end_per_group(GroupName, Config) ->
  211:   ssl_test_lib:end_per_group(GroupName, Config).
  212: 
  213: init_per_testcase(Testcase, Config) when Testcase == tls_server_handshake_timeout;
  214:                                          Testcase == tls_upgrade_with_timeout ->
  215:     ct:timetrap({seconds, 10}),
  216:     Config;
  217: init_per_testcase(_, Config) ->
  218:     ct:timetrap({seconds, 5}),
  219:     Config.
  220: end_per_testcase(_TestCase, Config) ->
  221:     Config.
  222: 
  223: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  224: %% Test Cases --------------------------------------------------------
  225: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  226: tls_upgrade() ->
  227:     [{doc,"Test that you can upgrade an tcp connection to an ssl connection"}].
  228: 
  229: tls_upgrade(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  230:     ClientOpts = ssl_test_lib:ssl_options(client_rsa_opts, Config),
  231:     ServerOpts = ssl_test_lib:ssl_options(server_rsa_opts, Config),
  232:     {ClientNode, ServerNode, Hostname} = ssl_test_lib:run_where(Config),
  233:     TcpOpts = [binary, {reuseaddr, true}],
  234: 
  235:     Server = ssl_test_lib:start_upgrade_server([{node, ServerNode}, {port, 0},
  236: 						{from, self()},
  237: 						{mfa, {?MODULE,
  238: 						       upgrade_result, []}},
  239: 						{tcp_options,
  240: 						 [{active, false} | TcpOpts]},
  241: 						{ssl_options, [{verify, verify_peer} | ServerOpts]}]),
  242:     Port = ssl_test_lib:inet_port(Server),
  243:     Client = ssl_test_lib:start_upgrade_client([{node, ClientNode},
  244: 						{port, Port},
  245: 				   {host, Hostname},
  246: 				   {from, self()},
  247: 				   {mfa, {?MODULE, upgrade_result, []}},
  248: 				   {tcp_options, [binary]},
  249: 				   {ssl_options,  [{verify, verify_peer},
  250:                                                    {server_name_indication, Hostname} | ClientOpts]}]),
  251: 
  252:     ?CT_LOG("Client ~p  Server ~p ~n", [Client, Server]),
  253: 
  254:     ssl_test_lib:check_result(Server, ok, Client, ok),
  255: 
  256:     ssl_test_lib:close(Server),
  257:     ssl_test_lib:close(Client).
  258: 
  259: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  260: tls_upgrade_new_opts() ->
  261:     [{doc,"Test that you can upgrade an tcp connection to an ssl connection and give new socket opts"}].
  262: 
  263: tls_upgrade_new_opts(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  264:     ClientOpts = ssl_test_lib:ssl_options(client_rsa_opts, Config),
  265:     ServerOpts = ssl_test_lib:ssl_options(server_rsa_opts, Config),
  266:     {ClientNode, ServerNode, Hostname} = ssl_test_lib:run_where(Config),
  267:     TcpOpts = [binary, {reuseaddr, true}],
  268: 
  269:     Server = ssl_test_lib:start_upgrade_server([{node, ServerNode}, {port, 0},
  270: 						{from, self()},
  271: 						{mfa, {?MODULE,
  272: 						       upgrade_result_new_opts, []}},
  273: 						{tcp_options,
  274: 						 [{active, false} | TcpOpts]},
  275: 						{ssl_options, [{verify, verify_peer},
  276:                                                                {mode, list} | ServerOpts]}]),
  277:     Port = ssl_test_lib:inet_port(Server),
  278:     Client = ssl_test_lib:start_upgrade_client([{node, ClientNode},
  279: 						{port, Port},
  280: 				   {host, Hostname},
  281: 				   {from, self()},
  282: 				   {mfa, {?MODULE, upgrade_result_new_opts, []}},
  283: 				   {tcp_options, [binary]},
  284: 				   {ssl_options,  [{verify, verify_peer},
  285:                                                    {mode, list},
  286:                                                    {server_name_indication, Hostname} | ClientOpts]}]),
  287: 
  288:     ?CT_LOG("Client ~p  Server ~p ~n", [Client, Server]),
  289: 
  290:     ssl_test_lib:check_result(Server, ok, Client, ok),
  291: 
  292:     ssl_test_lib:close(Server),
  293:     ssl_test_lib:close(Client).
  294: 
  295: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  296: tls_upgrade_new_opts_with_sni_fun() ->
  297:     [{doc,"Test that you can upgrade an tcp connection to an ssl connection with new versions option provided by sni_fun"}].
  298: 
  299: tls_upgrade_new_opts_with_sni_fun(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  300:     ClientOpts = ssl_test_lib:ssl_options(client_rsa_verify_opts, Config),
  301:     ServerOpts = ssl_test_lib:ssl_options(server_rsa_opts, Config),
  302:     {ClientNode, ServerNode, Hostname} = ssl_test_lib:run_where(Config),
  303:     TcpOpts = [binary, {reuseaddr, true}],
  304:     Version = ssl_test_lib:protocol_version(Config),
  305:     NewVersions = new_versions(Version),
  306:     Ciphers =  ssl:filter_cipher_suites(ssl:cipher_suites(all, Version), []),
  307: 
  308:     NewOpts = [{versions, NewVersions},
  309:                {ciphers, Ciphers},
  310:                {verify, verify_peer}],
  311: 
  312:     Server = ssl_test_lib:start_upgrade_server([{node, ServerNode}, {port, 0},
  313: 						{from, self()},
  314: 						{mfa, {?MODULE,
  315: 						       upgrade_result, []}},
  316: 						{tcp_options,
  317: 						 [{active, false} | TcpOpts]},
  318: 						{ssl_options, [{versions,  [Version |NewVersions]}, {sni_fun, fun(_SNI) -> ServerOpts ++ NewOpts end}]}]),
  319:     Port = ssl_test_lib:inet_port(Server),
  320:     Client = ssl_test_lib:start_upgrade_client([{node, ClientNode},
  321: 						{port, Port},
  322: 				   {host, Hostname},
  323: 				   {from, self()},
  324: 				   {mfa, {?MODULE, upgrade_result, []}},
  325: 				   {tcp_options, [binary]},
  326: 				   {ssl_options,  [{versions,  [Version |NewVersions]},
  327:                                                    {ciphers, Ciphers},
  328:                                                    {server_name_indication, Hostname} | ClientOpts]}]),
  329: 
  330:     ?CT_LOG("Client ~p  Server ~p ~n", [Client, Server]),
  331: 
  332:     ssl_test_lib:check_result(Server, ok, Client, ok),
  333: 
  334:     ssl_test_lib:close(Server),
  335:     ssl_test_lib:close(Client).
  336: 
  337: 
  338: 
  339: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  340: tls_upgrade_with_timeout() ->
  341:     [{doc,"Test handshake/3"}].
  342: 
  343: tls_upgrade_with_timeout(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  344:     ClientOpts = ssl_test_lib:ssl_options(client_rsa_opts, Config),
  345:     ServerOpts = ssl_test_lib:ssl_options(server_rsa_opts, Config),
  346:     {ClientNode, ServerNode, Hostname} = ssl_test_lib:run_where(Config),
  347:     TcpOpts = [binary, {reuseaddr, true}],
  348: 
  349:     Server = ssl_test_lib:start_upgrade_server([{node, ServerNode}, {port, 0},
  350: 						{from, self()},
  351: 						{timeout, 5000},
  352: 						{mfa, {?MODULE,
  353: 						       upgrade_result, []}},
  354: 						{tcp_options,
  355: 						 [{active, false} | TcpOpts]},
  356: 						{ssl_options, [{verify, verify_peer} | ServerOpts]}]),
  357:     Port = ssl_test_lib:inet_port(Server),
  358:     Client = ssl_test_lib:start_upgrade_client([{node, ClientNode},
  359: 						{port, Port},
  360: 						{host, Hostname},
  361: 						{from, self()},
  362: 						{mfa, {?MODULE, upgrade_result, []}},
  363: 						{tcp_options, TcpOpts},
  364: 						{ssl_options, [{verify, verify_peer},
  365:                                                                {server_name_indication, Hostname} | ClientOpts]}]),
  366: 
  367:     ?CT_LOG("Client ~p  Server ~p ~n", [Client, Server]),
  368: 
  369:     ssl_test_lib:check_result(Server, ok, Client, ok),
  370: 
  371:     ssl_test_lib:close(Server),
  372:     ssl_test_lib:close(Client).
  373: 
  374: tls_upgrade_with_client_timeout() ->
  375:     [{doc,"Test upgrade with connect/3 and a timeout value"}].
  376: 
  377: tls_upgrade_with_client_timeout(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  378:     ClientOpts = ssl_test_lib:ssl_options(client_rsa_opts, Config),
  379:     ServerOpts = ssl_test_lib:ssl_options(server_rsa_opts, Config),
  380:     {ClientNode, ServerNode, Hostname} = ssl_test_lib:run_where(Config),
  381:     TcpOpts = [binary, {reuseaddr, true}],
  382: 
  383:     Server = ssl_test_lib:start_upgrade_server([{node, ServerNode}, {port, 0},
  384: 						{from, self()},
  385: 						{mfa, {?MODULE,
  386: 						       upgrade_result, []}},
  387: 						{tcp_options,
  388: 						 [{active, false} | TcpOpts]},
  389: 						{ssl_options, [{verify, verify_peer} | ServerOpts]}]),
  390:     Port = ssl_test_lib:inet_port(Server),
  391:     Client = ssl_test_lib:start_upgrade_client_error([{node, ClientNode},
  392: 						{port, Port},
  393: 				   {host, Hostname},
  394: 				   {from, self()},
  395:                                    {timeout, 0},
  396: 				   {mfa, {?MODULE, upgrade_result, []}},
  397: 				   {tcp_options, [binary]},
  398: 				   {ssl_options,  [{verify, verify_peer},
  399:                                                    {server_name_indication, Hostname} | ClientOpts]}]),
  400: 
  401:     ?CT_LOG("Client ~p  Server ~p", [Client, Server]),
  402:     ok = ssl_test_lib:check_result(Client, {error, timeout}),
  403:     ssl_test_lib:close(Server).
  404: 
  405: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  406: tls_downgrade() ->
  407:       [{doc,"Test that you can downgarde an ssl connection to an tcp connection"}].
  408: tls_downgrade(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  409:     ClientOpts = ssl_test_lib:ssl_options(client_rsa_opts, Config),
  410:     ServerOpts = ssl_test_lib:ssl_options(server_rsa_opts, Config),
  411: 
  412:     {ClientNode, ServerNode, Hostname} = ssl_test_lib:run_where(Config),
  413: 
  414:     Server = ssl_test_lib:start_server([{node, ServerNode}, {port, 0},
  415: 					{from, self()},
  416: 					{mfa, {?MODULE, tls_downgrade_result, [self()]}},
  417: 					{options, [{active, false}, {verify, verify_peer} | ServerOpts]}]),
  418:     Port = ssl_test_lib:inet_port(Server),
  419:     Client = ssl_test_lib:start_client([{node, ClientNode}, {port, Port},
  420: 					{host, Hostname},
  421: 					{from, self()},
  422: 					{mfa, {?MODULE, tls_downgrade_result, [self()]}},
  423: 					{options, [{active, false}, {verify, verify_peer} | ClientOpts]}]),
  424: 
  425:     ssl_test_lib:check_result(Server, ready, Client, ready),
  426: 
  427:     Server ! go,
  428:     Client ! go,
  429: 
  430:     ssl_test_lib:check_result(Server, ok, Client, ok),
  431:     ssl_test_lib:close(Server),
  432:     ssl_test_lib:close(Client).
  433: 
  434: 
  435: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  436: tls_shutdown() ->
  437:     [{doc,"Test API function ssl:shutdown/2"}].
  438: tls_shutdown(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  439:     ClientOpts = ssl_test_lib:ssl_options(client_rsa_opts, Config),
  440:     ServerOpts = ssl_test_lib:ssl_options(server_rsa_opts, Config),
  441:     {ClientNode, ServerNode, Hostname} = ssl_test_lib:run_where(Config),
  442:     Server = ssl_test_lib:start_server([{node, ServerNode}, {port, 0},
  443: 					{from, self()},
  444: 			   {mfa, {?MODULE, tls_shutdown_result, [server]}},
  445: 			   {options, [{exit_on_close, false},
  446: 				      {active, false} | ServerOpts]}]),
  447:     Port = ssl_test_lib:inet_port(Server),
  448:     Client = ssl_test_lib:start_client([{node, ClientNode}, {port, Port},
  449: 					{host, Hostname},
  450: 					{from, self()},
  451: 					{mfa,
  452: 					 {?MODULE, tls_shutdown_result, [client]}},
  453: 					{options,
  454: 					 [{exit_on_close, false},
  455: 					  {active, false} | ClientOpts]}]),
  456: 
  457:     ssl_test_lib:check_result(Server, ok, Client, ok),
  458: 
  459:     ssl_test_lib:close(Server),
  460:     ssl_test_lib:close(Client).
  461: 
  462: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  463: tls_shutdown_write() ->
  464:     [{doc,"Test API function ssl:shutdown/2 with option write."}].
  465: tls_shutdown_write(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  466:     ClientOpts = ssl_test_lib:ssl_options(client_rsa_opts, Config),
  467:     ServerOpts = ssl_test_lib:ssl_options(server_rsa_opts, Config),
  468:     {ClientNode, ServerNode, Hostname} = ssl_test_lib:run_where(Config),
  469:     Server = ssl_test_lib:start_server([{node, ServerNode}, {port, 0},
  470: 					{from, self()},
  471: 			   {mfa, {?MODULE, tls_shutdown_write_result, [server]}},
  472: 			   {options, [{active, false} | ServerOpts]}]),
  473:     Port = ssl_test_lib:inet_port(Server),
  474:     Client = ssl_test_lib:start_client([{node, ClientNode}, {port, Port},
  475: 					{host, Hostname},
  476: 			   {from, self()},
  477: 			   {mfa, {?MODULE, tls_shutdown_write_result, [client]}},
  478: 			   {options, [{active, false} | ClientOpts]}]),
  479: 
  480:     ssl_test_lib:check_result(Server, ok, Client, {error, closed}).
  481: 
  482: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  483: tls_shutdown_both() ->
  484:     [{doc,"Test API function ssl:shutdown/2 with option both."}].
  485: tls_shutdown_both(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  486:     ClientOpts = ssl_test_lib:ssl_options(client_rsa_opts, Config),
  487:     ServerOpts = ssl_test_lib:ssl_options(server_rsa_opts, Config),
  488:     {ClientNode, ServerNode, Hostname} = ssl_test_lib:run_where(Config),
  489:     Server = ssl_test_lib:start_server([{node, ServerNode}, {port, 0},
  490: 					{from, self()},
  491: 			   {mfa, {?MODULE, tls_shutdown_both_result, [server]}},
  492: 			   {options, [{active, false} | ServerOpts]}]),
  493:     Port  = ssl_test_lib:inet_port(Server),
  494:     Client = ssl_test_lib:start_client([{node, ClientNode}, {port, Port},
  495: 					{host, Hostname},
  496: 			   {from, self()},
  497: 			   {mfa, {?MODULE, tls_shutdown_both_result, [client]}},
  498: 			   {options, [{active, false} | ClientOpts]}]),
  499: 
  500:     ssl_test_lib:check_result(Server, ok, Client, {error, closed}).
  501: 
  502: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  503: tls_shutdown_error() ->
  504:     [{doc,"Test ssl:shutdown/2 error handling"}].
  505: tls_shutdown_error(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  506:     ServerOpts = ssl_test_lib:ssl_options(server_rsa_opts, Config),
  507:     Port = ssl_test_lib:inet_port(node()),
  508:     {ok, Listen} = ssl:listen(Port, ServerOpts),
  509:     {error, enotconn} = ssl:shutdown(Listen, read_write),
  510:     ok = ssl:close(Listen),
  511:     {error, closed} = ssl:shutdown(Listen, read_write).
  512: 
  513: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  514: tls_client_closes_socket() ->
  515:     [{doc,"Test what happens when client closes socket before handshake is completed"}].
  516: 
  517: tls_client_closes_socket(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  518:     ServerOpts = ssl_test_lib:ssl_options(server_opts, Config),
  519:     {ClientNode, ServerNode, Hostname} = ssl_test_lib:run_where(Config),
  520:     TcpOpts = [binary, {reuseaddr, true}],
  521: 
  522:     Server = ssl_test_lib:start_upgrade_server_error([{node, ServerNode}, {port, 0},
  523: 						      {from, self()},
  524: 						      {tcp_options, TcpOpts},
  525: 						      {ssl_options, ServerOpts}]),
  526:     Port = ssl_test_lib:inet_port(Server),
  527: 
  528:     Connect = fun() ->
  529: 		      {ok, _Socket} = rpc:call(ClientNode, gen_tcp, connect,
  530: 					      [Hostname, Port, [binary]]),
  531: 		      %% Make sure that handshake is called before
  532: 		      %% client process ends and closes socket.
  533: 		      ct:sleep(?SLEEP)
  534: 	      end,
  535: 
  536:     _Client = spawn_link(Connect),
  537: 
  538:     ssl_test_lib:check_result(Server, {error,closed}).
  539: 
  540: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  541: tls_reset_in_active_once() ->
  542:     [{doc, "Test that ssl_closed is delivered in active once with non-empty buffer, check ERL-420."}].
  543: 
  544: tls_reset_in_active_once(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  545:     ClientOpts = ssl_test_lib:ssl_options(client_rsa_opts, Config),
  546:     ServerOpts = ssl_test_lib:ssl_options(server_rsa_opts, Config),
  547:     {_ClientNode, _ServerNode, Hostname} = ssl_test_lib:run_where(Config),
  548:     TcpOpts = [binary, {reuseaddr, true}],
  549:     Port = ssl_test_lib:inet_port(node()),
  550:     Server = fun() ->
  551: 		     {ok, Listen} = gen_tcp:listen(Port, TcpOpts),
  552: 		     {ok, TcpServerSocket} = gen_tcp:accept(Listen),
  553: 		     {ok, ServerSocket} = ssl:handshake(TcpServerSocket, ServerOpts),
  554: 		     lists:foreach(
  555: 		       fun(_) ->
  556: 			       ssl:send(ServerSocket, "some random message\r\n")
  557: 		       end, lists:seq(1, 20)),
  558: 		     %% Close TCP instead of SSL socket to trigger the bug:
  559: 		     gen_tcp:close(TcpServerSocket),
  560: 		     gen_tcp:close(Listen)
  561: 	     end,
  562:     spawn_link(Server),
  563:     {ok, Socket} = ssl:connect(Hostname, Port, [{active, false} | ClientOpts]),
  564:     Result = tls_closed_in_active_once_loop(Socket),
  565:     ssl:close(Socket),
  566:     case Result of
  567: 	ok -> ok;
  568: 	_ -> ct:fail(Result)
  569:     end.
  570: 
  571: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  572: tls_closed_in_active_once() ->
  573:     [{doc, "Test that active once can be used to deliver not only all data"
  574:       " but even the close message, see ERL-1409, in normal operation."
  575:       " This is also test, with slightly different circumstances in"
  576:       " the old tls_closed_in_active_once test"
  577:       " renamed tls_reset_in_active_once"}].
  578: 
  579: tls_closed_in_active_once(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  580:     ClientOpts = ssl_test_lib:ssl_options(client_rsa_opts, Config),
  581:     ServerOpts = ssl_test_lib:ssl_options(server_rsa_opts, Config),
  582:     {_ClientNode, _ServerNode, Hostname} = ssl_test_lib:run_where(Config),
  583:     TcpOpts = [binary, {reuseaddr, true}],
  584:     Port = ssl_test_lib:inet_port(node()),
  585:     Server = fun() ->
  586: 		     {ok, Listen} = gen_tcp:listen(Port, TcpOpts),
  587: 		     {ok, TcpServerSocket} = gen_tcp:accept(Listen),
  588: 		     {ok, ServerSocket} = ssl:handshake(TcpServerSocket, ServerOpts),
  589: 		     lists:foreach(
  590: 		       fun(_) ->
  591: 			       ssl:send(ServerSocket, "some random message\r\n")
  592: 		       end, lists:seq(1, 20)),
  593: 		     ssl:close(ServerSocket)
  594: 	     end,
  595:     spawn_link(Server),
  596:     {ok, Socket} = ssl:connect(Hostname, Port, [{active, false} | ClientOpts]),
  597:     Result = tls_closed_in_active_once_loop(Socket),
  598:     ssl:close(Socket),
  599:     case Result of
  600: 	ok -> ok;
  601: 	_ -> ct:fail(Result)
  602:     end.
  603: 
  604: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  605: tls_monitor_listener() ->
  606:     [{doc, "Check that TLS server processes are shutdown when listener socket is closed."
  607:       "Note that individual already established connections may live longer."}].
  608: 
  609: tls_monitor_listener(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  610:     ServerOpts = ssl_test_lib:ssl_options(server_rsa_opts, Config),
  611:     ClientOpts = ssl_test_lib:ssl_options(client_rsa_opts, Config),
  612:     Version = ssl_test_lib:protocol_version(Config),
  613:     {ClientNode, ServerNode, Hostname} = ssl_test_lib:run_where(Config),
  614: 
  615:     Server1 = ssl_test_lib:start_server([{node, ServerNode}, {port, 0},
  616: 					{from, self()},
  617:                                          {mfa, {ssl_test_lib, send_recv_result_active, []}},
  618:                                          {options, tls_monitor_listen_opts(Version, ServerOpts)}]),
  619:     Port1 = ssl_test_lib:inet_port(Server1),
  620: 
  621:     Server2 = ssl_test_lib:start_server([{node, ServerNode}, {port, 0},
  622: 					{from, self()},
  623:                                          {options, tls_monitor_listen_opts(Version, ServerOpts)}]),
  624:     _Port2 = ssl_test_lib:inet_port(Server2),
  625: 
  626:     2 = count_children(workers, ssl_listen_tracker_sup),
  627: 
  628:     Sessions = session_info(Version),
  629: 
  630:     true = (Sessions == 2),
  631: 
  632:     Client1 = ssl_test_lib:start_client([{node, ClientNode}, {port, Port1},
  633:                                          {host, Hostname},
  634:                                          {from, self()},
  635:                                          {mfa, {ssl_test_lib, send_recv_result_active, []}},
  636:                                          {options, tls_monitor_client_opts(Version, ClientOpts)}
  637: 					]),
  638: 
  639:     ssl_test_lib:check_result(Server1, ok, Client1, ok),
  640:     Monitor = erlang:monitor(process, Server1),
  641:     ssl_test_lib:close(Server1),
  642:     receive
  643:         {'DOWN', Monitor, _, _, _} ->
  644:             ct:sleep(1000)
  645:     end,
  646: 
  647: 
  648:     Sessions1 = session_info(Version),
  649:     true = (Sessions1 == 1),
  650: 
  651:     1 = count_children(workers, ssl_listen_tracker_sup).
  652: 
  653: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  654: tls_tcp_msg() ->
  655:     [{doc,"Test what happens when a tcp tries to connect, i,e. a bad (ssl) packet is sent first"}].
  656: 
  657: tls_tcp_msg(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  658:     ServerOpts = ssl_test_lib:ssl_options(server_rsa_opts, Config),
  659:     {_, ServerNode, Hostname} = ssl_test_lib:run_where(Config),
  660:     TcpOpts = [binary, {reuseaddr, true}, {active, false}],
  661: 
  662:     Server = ssl_test_lib:start_upgrade_server_error([{node, ServerNode}, {port, 0},
  663: 						      {from, self()},
  664: 						      {timeout, 5000},
  665: 						      {mfa, {?MODULE, dummy, []}},
  666: 						      {tcp_options, TcpOpts},
  667: 						      {ssl_options, ServerOpts}]),
  668:     Port = ssl_test_lib:inet_port(Server),
  669: 
  670:     {ok, Socket} = gen_tcp:connect(Hostname, Port, [binary, {packet, 0}]),
  671:     ?CT_LOG("connected to Server ~p ~n", [Server]),
  672:     gen_tcp:send(Socket, "<SOME GARBLED NON SSL MESSAGE>"),
  673: 
  674:     receive
  675: 	{tcp_closed, Socket} ->
  676: 	    receive
  677: 		{Server, {error, Error}} ->
  678: 		    ?CT_LOG("Error ~p", [Error])
  679: 	    end
  680:     end.
  681: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  682: tls_tcp_msg_big() ->
  683:     [{doc,"Test what happens when a tcp tries to connect, i,e. a bad big (ssl) packet is sent first"}].
  684: 
  685: tls_tcp_msg_big(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  686:     process_flag(trap_exit, true),
  687:     ServerOpts = ssl_test_lib:ssl_options(server_rsa_opts, Config),
  688:     {_, ServerNode, Hostname} = ssl_test_lib:run_where(Config),
  689:     TcpOpts = [binary, {reuseaddr, true}],
  690: 
  691:     Rand = crypto:strong_rand_bytes(?MAX_CIPHER_TEXT_LENGTH+1),
  692:     Server = ssl_test_lib:start_upgrade_server_error([{node, ServerNode}, {port, 0},
  693: 						      {from, self()},
  694: 						      {timeout, 5000},
  695: 						      {mfa, {?MODULE, dummy, []}},
  696: 						      {tcp_options, TcpOpts},
  697: 						      {ssl_options, ServerOpts}]),
  698:     Port = ssl_test_lib:inet_port(Server),
  699: 
  700:     {ok, Socket} = gen_tcp:connect(Hostname, Port, [binary, {packet, 0}]),
  701:     ?CT_LOG("connected to Server ~p ~n", [Server]),
  702: 
  703:     gen_tcp:send(Socket, <<?BYTE(0),
  704: 			   ?BYTE(3), ?BYTE(1), ?UINT16(?MAX_CIPHER_TEXT_LENGTH), Rand/binary>>),
  705: 
  706:     receive
  707: 	{tcp_closed, Socket} ->
  708: 	    receive
  709: 		{Server, {error, timeout}} ->
  710: 		    ct:fail("hangs");
  711: 		{Server, {error, Error}} ->
  712: 		    ?CT_LOG("Error ~p", [Error]);
  713: 		{'EXIT', Server, _} ->
  714: 		    ok
  715: 	    end
  716:     end.
  717: 
  718: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  719: tls_dont_crash_on_handshake_garbage() ->
  720:     [{doc, "Ensure SSL server worker thows an alert on garbage during handshake "
  721:       "instead of crashing and exposing state to user code"}].
  722: 
  723: tls_dont_crash_on_handshake_garbage(Config) ->
  724:     ServerOpts = ssl_test_lib:ssl_options(server_rsa_opts, Config),
  725:     Version = ssl_test_lib:protocol_version(Config),
  726:     {_ClientNode, ServerNode, Hostname} = ssl_test_lib:run_where(Config),
  727: 
  728:     Server = ssl_test_lib:start_server([{node, ServerNode}, {port, 0},
  729:                                         {from, self()},
  730:                                         {mfa, ssl_test_lib, no_result},
  731:                                         {options, [{versions, [Version]} | ServerOpts]}]),
  732:     Port = ssl_test_lib:inet_port(Server),
  733: 
  734:     {ok, Socket} = gen_tcp:connect(Hostname, Port, [binary, {active, false}]),
  735: 
  736:     %% Send hello and garbage record
  737:     ok = gen_tcp:send(Socket,
  738:                       [<<22, 3,3, 49:16, 1, 45:24, 3,3, % client_hello
  739:                          16#deadbeef:256, % 32 'random' bytes = 256 bits
  740:                          0, 6:16, 0,255, 0,61, 0,57, 1, 0 >>, % some hello values
  741:                        <<22, 3,3, 5:16, 92,64,37,228,209>> % garbage
  742:                       ]),
  743:     %% Send unexpected change_cipher_spec
  744:     ok = gen_tcp:send(Socket, <<20, 3,3, 12:16, 111,40,244,7,137,224,16,109,197,110,249,152>>),
  745:     gen_tcp:close(Socket),
  746:     % Ensure we receive an alert, not sudden disconnect
  747:     case Version of
  748:         'tlsv1.3' ->
  749:             ssl_test_lib:check_server_alert(Server, protocol_version);
  750:         _  ->
  751:             ssl_test_lib:check_server_alert(Server, handshake_failure)
  752:     end.
  753: 
  754: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  755: tls_tcp_error_propagation_in_active_mode() ->
  756:     [{doc,"Test that process receives {ssl_error, Socket, closed} when tcp error ocurres"}].
  757: tls_tcp_error_propagation_in_active_mode(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  758:     ClientOpts = ssl_test_lib:ssl_options(client_rsa_opts, Config),
  759:     ServerOpts = ssl_test_lib:ssl_options(server_rsa_opts, Config),
  760: 
  761:     {ClientNode, ServerNode, Hostname} = ssl_test_lib:run_where(Config),
  762: 
  763:     Server  = ssl_test_lib:start_server([{node, ServerNode}, {port, 0},
  764: 					 {from, self()},
  765: 					 {mfa, {ssl_test_lib, no_result, []}},
  766: 					 {options, ServerOpts}]),
  767:     Port = ssl_test_lib:inet_port(Server),
  768:     {Client, #sslsocket{pid=[Pid|_]} = SslSocket} = ssl_test_lib:start_client([return_socket,
  769:                                                                                {node, ClientNode}, {port, Port},
  770:                                                                                {host, Hostname},
  771:                                                                                {from, self()},
  772:                                                                                {mfa, {?MODULE, receive_msg, []}},
  773:                                                                                {options, ClientOpts}]),
  774: 
  775:     {status, _, _, StatusInfo} = sys:get_status(Pid),
  776:     [_, _,_, _, Prop] = StatusInfo,
  777:     State = ssl_test_lib:state(Prop),
  778:     StaticEnv = element(2, State),
  779:     Socket = element(11, StaticEnv),
  780:     %% Fake tcp error
  781:     Pid ! {tcp_error, Socket, etimedout},
  782: 
  783:     ssl_test_lib:check_result(Client, {ssl_closed, SslSocket}).
  784: 
  785: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  786: tls_reject_warning_alert_in_initial_hs() ->
  787:     [{doc,"Test sending warning ALERT instead of client hello"}].
  788: tls_reject_warning_alert_in_initial_hs(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  789:     ServerOpts = ssl_test_lib:ssl_options(server_rsa_opts, Config),
  790:     {_Clientnode, ServerNode, _Hostname} = ssl_test_lib:run_where(Config),
  791:     {Major, Minor} = case ssl_test_lib:protocol_version(Config, tuple) of
  792:                          ?TLS_1_3 ->
  793:                              ?TLS_1_2;
  794:                          Other ->
  795:                              Other
  796:                      end,
  797:     Server  = ssl_test_lib:start_server([{node, ServerNode}, {port, 0},
  798: 					 {from, self()},
  799: 					 {mfa, {ssl_test_lib, no_result, []}},
  800: 					 {options, [{versions, [ssl_test_lib:protocol_version(Config)]} | ServerOpts]}]),
  801:     Port = ssl_test_lib:inet_port(Server),
  802:     {ok, Socket}  = gen_tcp:connect("localhost", Port, [{active, false}, binary]),
  803:     NoRenegotiateAlert = <<?BYTE(?ALERT), ?BYTE(Major), ?BYTE(Minor), ?UINT16(2), ?BYTE(?WARNING), ?BYTE(?NO_RENEGOTIATION)>>,
  804:     gen_tcp:send(Socket, NoRenegotiateAlert),
  805:     UnexpectedMsgAlert = <<?BYTE(?ALERT), ?BYTE(Major), ?BYTE(Minor), ?UINT16(2), ?BYTE(?FATAL), ?BYTE(?UNEXPECTED_MESSAGE)>>,
  806:     {ok, UnexpectedMsgAlert} = gen_tcp:recv(Socket, 7),
  807:     {error, closed} = gen_tcp:recv(Socket, 0).
  808: 
  809: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  810: tls_reject_fake_warning_alert_in_initial_hs() ->
  811:     [{doc,"Test sending 'fake' warning ALERT covers different function clause pre TLS-1.3"}].
  812: tls_reject_fake_warning_alert_in_initial_hs(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  813:     ServerOpts = ssl_test_lib:ssl_options(server_rsa_opts, Config),

  816:                          ?TLS_1_3 ->
  817:                              ?TLS_1_2;
  818:                          Other ->
  819:                              Other
  820:                      end,
  821:     Server  = ssl_test_lib:start_server([{node, ServerNode}, {port, 0},
  822: 					 {from, self()},
  823: 					 {mfa, {ssl_test_lib, no_result, []}},
  824: 					 {options, [{versions, [ssl_test_lib:protocol_version(Config)]} | ServerOpts]}]),
  825:     Port = ssl_test_lib:inet_port(Server),
  826:     {ok, Socket}  = gen_tcp:connect("localhost", Port, [{active, false}, binary]),
  827:     NoRenegotiateAlert = <<?BYTE(?ALERT), ?BYTE(Major), ?BYTE(Minor), ?UINT16(2), ?BYTE(?WARNING), ?BYTE(?UNEXPECTED_MESSAGE)>>,
  828:     gen_tcp:send(Socket, NoRenegotiateAlert),
  829:     UnexpectedMsgAlert = <<?BYTE(?ALERT), ?BYTE(Major), ?BYTE(Minor), ?UINT16(2), ?BYTE(?FATAL), ?BYTE(?UNEXPECTED_MESSAGE)>>,
  830:     {ok, UnexpectedMsgAlert} = gen_tcp:recv(Socket, 7),
  831:     {error, closed} = gen_tcp:recv(Socket, 0).

  833: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  834: tls_app_data_in_initial_hs_state() ->
  835:      [{doc,"Test sending application data instead of initial client hello. In TLS-1.3 application data can be sent",
  836:        "in first round trip but not before client hello."}].
  837: tls_app_data_in_initial_hs_state(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  838:     ServerOpts = ssl_test_lib:ssl_options(server_rsa_opts, Config),
  839:     {_ClientNode, ServerNode, _Hostname} = ssl_test_lib:run_where(Config),
  840:     Version = ssl_test_lib:protocol_version(Config, tuple),
  841:     {Major, Minor} = case Version of
  842:                          ?TLS_1_3 ->
  843:                              ?TLS_1_2;
  844:                          Other ->
  845:                              Other
  846:                      end,
  847:     Server  = ssl_test_lib:start_server([{node, ServerNode}, {port, 0},
  848: 					 {from, self()},
  849: 					 {mfa, {ssl_test_lib, no_result, []}},
  850: 					 {options, [{versions, [ssl_test_lib:protocol_version(Config)]} | ServerOpts]}]),
  851:     Port = ssl_test_lib:inet_port(Server),
  852:     {ok, Socket}  = gen_tcp:connect("localhost", Port, [{active, false}, binary]),
  853:     AppData = case Version of
  854:                   ?TLS_1_3 ->
  855:                       <<?BYTE(?APPLICATION_DATA), ?BYTE(3), ?BYTE(3), ?UINT16(4), ?BYTE($F), 
  856:                         ?BYTE($O), ?BYTE($O), ?BYTE(?APPLICATION_DATA)>>;
  857:                   _ ->
  858:                      <<?BYTE(?APPLICATION_DATA), ?BYTE(Major), ?BYTE(Minor), 
  859:                        ?UINT16(3), ?BYTE($F), ?BYTE($O), ?BYTE($O)>>
  860:               end,
  861:     gen_tcp:send(Socket, AppData),
  862:     UnexpectedMsgAlert = <<?BYTE(?ALERT), ?BYTE(Major), ?BYTE(Minor), ?UINT16(2), 
  863:                            ?BYTE(?FATAL), ?BYTE(?UNEXPECTED_MESSAGE)>>,
  864:     {ok, UnexpectedMsgAlert} = gen_tcp:recv(Socket, 7),
  865:     {error, closed} = gen_tcp:recv(Socket, 0).
  866: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  867: tls_13_reject_change_cipher_spec_as_first_msg() ->
  868:      [{doc,"change_cipher_spec messages can be sent in TLS-1.3 middlebox_comp_mode, but can not be sent as first msg"}].
  869: tls_13_reject_change_cipher_spec_as_first_msg(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  870:     ServerOpts = ssl_test_lib:ssl_options(server_rsa_opts, Config),
  871:     {_ClientNode, ServerNode, _Hostname} = ssl_test_lib:run_where(Config),
  872:     Server  = ssl_test_lib:start_server([{node, ServerNode}, {port, 0},
  873:                                          {from, self()},
  874:                                          {mfa, {ssl_test_lib, no_result, []}},
  875:                                          {options, [{versions, [ssl_test_lib:protocol_version(Config)]} | ServerOpts]}]),
  876:     Port = ssl_test_lib:inet_port(Server),
  877:     {ok, Socket}  = gen_tcp:connect("localhost", Port, [{active, false}, binary]),
  878:     ChangeCipherSpec = <<?BYTE(?CHANGE_CIPHER_SPEC), ?BYTE(3), ?BYTE(3),
  879:                          ?UINT16(1), ?BYTE(?CHANGE_CIPHER_SPEC_PROTO)>>,
  880:     gen_tcp:send(Socket, ChangeCipherSpec),
  881:     UnexpectedMsgAlert = <<?BYTE(?ALERT), ?BYTE(3), ?BYTE(3), ?UINT16(2),
  882:                            ?BYTE(?FATAL), ?BYTE(?UNEXPECTED_MESSAGE)>>,
  883:     {ok, UnexpectedMsgAlert} = gen_tcp:recv(Socket, 7),
  884:     {error, closed} = gen_tcp:recv(Socket, 0).
  885: 
  886: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  887: tls_13_middlebox_reject_change_cipher_spec_as_first_msg() ->
  888:      [{doc,"change_cipher_spec messages can be sent in TLS-1.3 middlebox_comp_mode, but can not be sent as first msg"}].
  889: tls_13_middlebox_reject_change_cipher_spec_as_first_msg(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  890:     ServerOpts = ssl_test_lib:ssl_options(server_rsa_opts, Config),
  891:     {_ClientNode, ServerNode, _Hostname} = ssl_test_lib:run_where(Config),
  892:     Server  = ssl_test_lib:start_server([{node, ServerNode}, {port, 0},
  893:                                          {from, self()},
  894:                                          {mfa, {ssl_test_lib, no_result, []}},
  895:                                          {options, [{middlebox_comp_mode, false},
  896:                                                     {versions, [ssl_test_lib:protocol_version(Config)]}
  897:                                                    | ServerOpts]}]),
  898:     Port = ssl_test_lib:inet_port(Server),
  899:     {ok, Socket}  = gen_tcp:connect("localhost", Port, [{active, false}, binary]),
  900:     ChangeCipherSpec = <<?BYTE(?CHANGE_CIPHER_SPEC), ?BYTE(3), ?BYTE(3),
  901:                          ?UINT16(1), ?BYTE(?CHANGE_CIPHER_SPEC_PROTO)>>,
  902:     gen_tcp:send(Socket, ChangeCipherSpec),
  903:     UnexpectedMsgAlert = <<?BYTE(?ALERT), ?BYTE(3), ?BYTE(3), ?UINT16(2),
  904:                            ?BYTE(?FATAL), ?BYTE(?UNEXPECTED_MESSAGE)>>,
  905:     {ok, UnexpectedMsgAlert} = gen_tcp:recv(Socket, 7),
  906:     {error, closed} = gen_tcp:recv(Socket, 0).
  907: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  908: peername() ->
  909:     [{doc,"Test API function peername/1"}].
  910: 
  911: peername(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  912:     ClientOpts = ssl_test_lib:ssl_options(client_rsa_opts, Config),
  913:     ServerOpts = ssl_test_lib:ssl_options(server_rsa_opts, Config),
  914:     {ClientNode, ServerNode, Hostname} = ssl_test_lib:run_where(Config),
  915:     Server = ssl_test_lib:start_server([{node, ServerNode}, {port, 0},
  916: 					{from, self()},
  917: 			   {mfa, {ssl, peername, []}},
  918: 			   {options, ServerOpts}]),
  919:     Port = ssl_test_lib:inet_port(Server),
  920:     Client = ssl_test_lib:start_client([{node, ClientNode}, {port, Port},
  921: 					{host, Hostname},
  922: 					{from, self()},
  923: 					{mfa, {ssl, peername, []}},
  924: 					{options, [{port, 0} | ClientOpts]}]),
  925: 
  926:     ClientPort = ssl_test_lib:inet_port(Client),
  927:     ServerIp = ssl_test_lib:node_to_hostip(ServerNode, server),
  928:     ClientIp = ssl_test_lib:node_to_hostip(ClientNode, client),
  929:     ServerMsg = {ok, {ClientIp, ClientPort}},
  930:     ClientMsg = {ok, {ServerIp, Port}},
  931: 
  932:     ?CT_LOG("Client ~p  Server ~p ~n", [Client, Server]),
  933: 
  934:     ssl_test_lib:check_result(Server, ServerMsg, Client, ClientMsg),
  935: 
  936:     ssl_test_lib:close(Server),
  937:     ssl_test_lib:close(Client).
  938: 
  939: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  940: sockname() ->
  941:     [{doc,"Test API function sockname/1"}].
  942: sockname(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  943:     ClientOpts = ssl_test_lib:ssl_options(client_rsa_opts, Config),
  944:     ServerOpts = ssl_test_lib:ssl_options(server_rsa_opts, Config),
  945:     {ClientNode, ServerNode, Hostname} = ssl_test_lib:run_where(Config),
  946:     Server = ssl_test_lib:start_server([{node, ServerNode}, {port, 0},
  947: 					{from, self()},
  948: 			   {mfa, {ssl, sockname, []}},
  949: 			   {options, ServerOpts}]),
  950:     Port = ssl_test_lib:inet_port(Server),
  951:     Client = ssl_test_lib:start_client([{node, ClientNode}, {port, Port},
  952: 					{host, Hostname},
  953:                                         {from, self()},
  954:                                         {mfa, {ssl, sockname, []}},
  955:                                         {options, [{port, 0} | ClientOpts]}]),
  956: 
  957:     ClientPort = ssl_test_lib:inet_port(Client),
  958:     ServerIp = ssl_test_lib:node_to_hostip(ServerNode, server),
  959:     ClientIp = ssl_test_lib:node_to_hostip(ClientNode, client),
  960:     ServerMsg = {ok, {ServerIp, Port}},
  961:     ClientMsg = {ok, {ClientIp, ClientPort}},
  962: 
  963:     ?CT_LOG("Client ~p  Server ~p ~n", [Client, Server]),
  964: 
  965:     ssl_test_lib:check_result(Server, ServerMsg, Client, ClientMsg),
  966: 
  967:     ssl_test_lib:close(Server),
  968:     ssl_test_lib:close(Client).
  969: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  970: tls_server_handshake_timeout() ->
  971:     [{doc,"Test server handshake timeout"}].
  972: 
  973: tls_server_handshake_timeout(Config) ->
  974:     process_flag(trap_exit, true),
  975:     ServerOpts = ssl_test_lib:ssl_options(server_rsa_opts, Config),
  976:     {_, ServerNode, Hostname} = ssl_test_lib:run_where(Config),
  977:     Server = ssl_test_lib:start_server([{node, ServerNode}, {port, 0},
  978: 					{from, self()},
  979: 					{timeout, 5000},
  980: 					{mfa, {ssl_test_lib,
  981: 					       no_result_msg, []}},
  982: 					{options, ServerOpts}]),
  983:     Port = ssl_test_lib:inet_port(Server),
  984:     {ok, CSocket} = gen_tcp:connect(Hostname, Port, [binary, {active, true}]),
  985: 
  986:     receive
  987: 	{tcp_closed, CSocket} ->
  988: 	    ssl_test_lib:check_result(Server, {error, timeout}),
  989: 	    receive
  990: 		{'EXIT', Server, _} ->
  991: 		    %% Make sure supervisor had time to react on process exit
  992: 		    %% Could we come up with a better solution to this?
  993: 		    ct:sleep(500),
  994: 		    [] = supervisor:which_children(tls_connection_sup)
  995: 	    end
  996:     end.
  997: 
  998: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  999: transport_close() ->
 1000:     [{doc, "Test what happens if socket is closed on TCP level after a while of normal operation"}].
 1001: transport_close(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1002:     ClientOpts = ssl_test_lib:ssl_options(client_rsa_opts, Config),
 1003:     ServerOpts = ssl_test_lib:ssl_options(server_rsa_opts, Config),
 1004:     {ClientNode, ServerNode, Hostname} = ssl_test_lib:run_where(Config),
 1005:     Server =
 1006: 	ssl_test_lib:start_server([{node, ServerNode}, {port, 0},
 1007: 				   {from, self()},
 1008: 				   {mfa, {ssl_test_lib, send_recv_result, []}},
 1009: 				   {options,  [{active, false} | ServerOpts]}]),
 1010:     Port = ssl_test_lib:inet_port(Server),
 1011:     {ok, TcpS} = rpc:call(ClientNode, gen_tcp, connect,
 1012: 			  [Hostname,Port,[binary, {active, false}]]),
 1013:     {ok, SslS} = rpc:call(ClientNode, ssl, connect,
 1014: 			  [TcpS,[{active, false}|ClientOpts]]),
 1015: 
 1016:     ?CT_LOG("Server ~p ~n", [Server]),
 1017:     ok = ssl:send(SslS, "Hello world"),
 1018:     {ok,<<"Hello world">>} = ssl:recv(SslS, 11),
 1019:     gen_tcp:close(TcpS),
 1020:     {error, _} = ssl:send(SslS, "Hello world").
 1021: 
 1022: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
 1023: transport_close_in_inital_hello() ->
 1024:     [{doc, "Test what happens if server dies after calling transport_accept but before initiating handshake."}].
 1025: transport_close_in_inital_hello(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1026:     _ClientOpts = ssl_test_lib:ssl_options(client_rsa_opts, Config),
 1027:     ServerOpts = ssl_test_lib:ssl_options(server_rsa_opts, Config),
 1028:     {_, _, Hostname} = ssl_test_lib:run_where(Config),
 1029:     process_flag(trap_exit, true),
 1030: 
 1031:     Testcase = self(),
 1032: 
 1033:     Acceptor = spawn_link(fun() ->
 1034:                                   {ok, Listen} = ssl:listen(0, ServerOpts),
 1035:                                   {ok, {_, Port}} = ssl:sockname(Listen),
 1036:                                   Testcase ! {port, Port},
 1037:                                   {ok, _Accept} = ssl:transport_accept(Listen),
 1038:                                   receive
 1039:                                       die -> ok
 1040:                                   end
 1041:                           end),
 1042:     Port =  receive
 1043:                 {port, Port0} ->
 1044:                     Port0
 1045:             end,
 1046: 
 1047:     Connector = spawn_link(fun() ->
 1048:                                    {ok, _} = ssl:connect(Hostname, Port,
 1049:                                                          [{verify, verify_none}],
 1050:                                                          infinity
 1051:                                                         )
 1052:                            end),
 1053: 
 1054: 
 1055:     Sup = (whereis(tls_connection_sup)),
 1056: 
 1057:     check_connection_processes(Sup, 2),
 1058: 
 1059:     Acceptor ! die,
 1060: 
 1061:     receive
 1062:          {'EXIT', Acceptor, _} ->
 1063:             ok
 1064:     end,
 1065:     receive
 1066:         {'EXIT', Connector, _} ->
 1067:             ok
 1068:      end,
 1069:     check_connection_processes(Sup, 0).
 1070: 
 1071: check_connection_processes(Sup, N) ->
 1072:     check_connection_processes(Sup, N, 5).
 1073: 
 1074: check_connection_processes(Sup, N, 0) ->
 1075:     N = count_children(supervisors, Sup);
 1076: check_connection_processes(Sup, N, M) ->
 1077:     case count_children(supervisors, Sup) of
 1078:         N ->
 1079:             ok;
 1080:         _ ->
 1081:             ct:sleep(500),
 1082:             check_connection_processes(Sup, N, M-1)
 1083:     end.
 1084: 
 1085: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
 1086: emulated_options() ->
 1087:     [{doc,"Test API function getopts/2 and setopts/2"}].
 1088: 
 1089: emulated_options(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1090:     ClientOpts = ssl_test_lib:ssl_options(client_rsa_opts, Config),
 1091:     ServerOpts = ssl_test_lib:ssl_options(server_rsa_opts, Config),
 1092:     {ClientNode, ServerNode, Hostname} = ssl_test_lib:run_where(Config),
 1093:     Values = [{mode, list}, {packet, 0}, {header, 0},
 1094: 		      {active, true}],
 1095:     %% Shall be the reverse order of Values!
 1096:     Options = [active, header, packet, mode],
 1097: 
 1098:     NewValues = [{mode, binary}, {active, once}],
 1099:     %% Shall be the reverse order of NewValues!
 1100:     NewOptions = [active, mode],
 1101: 
 1102:     Server = ssl_test_lib:start_server([{node, ServerNode}, {port, 0},
 1103: 					{from, self()},
 1104: 			   {mfa, {?MODULE, tls_socket_options_result,
 1105: 				  [Options, Values, NewOptions, NewValues]}},
 1106: 			   {options, ServerOpts}]),
 1107:     Port = ssl_test_lib:inet_port(Server),
 1108:     Client = ssl_test_lib:start_client([{node, ClientNode}, {port, Port},
 1109: 					{host, Hostname},
 1110: 			   {from, self()},
 1111: 			   {mfa, {?MODULE, tls_socket_options_result,
 1112: 				  [Options, Values, NewOptions, NewValues]}},
 1113: 			   {options, ClientOpts}]),
 1114: 
 1115:     ssl_test_lib:check_result(Server, ok, Client, ok),
 1116: 
 1117:     ssl_test_lib:close(Server),
 1118: 
 1119:     {ok, Listen} = ssl:listen(0, ServerOpts),
 1120:     {ok,[{mode,list}]} = ssl:getopts(Listen, [mode]),
 1121:     ok = ssl:setopts(Listen, [{mode, binary}]),
 1122:     {ok,[{mode, binary}]} = ssl:getopts(Listen, [mode]),
 1123:     {ok,[{recbuf, _}]} = ssl:getopts(Listen, [recbuf]),
 1124:     ssl:close(Listen).
 1125: accept_pool() ->
 1126:     [{doc,"Test having an accept pool."}].
 1127: accept_pool(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1128:     ClientOpts = ssl_test_lib:ssl_options(client_rsa_opts, Config),
 1129:     ServerOpts = ssl_test_lib:ssl_options(server_rsa_opts, Config),
 1130: 
 1131:     {ClientNode, ServerNode, Hostname} = ssl_test_lib:run_where(Config),
 1132:     Server0 = ssl_test_lib:start_server([{node, ServerNode}, {port, 0},
 1133: 					{from, self()},
 1134: 					{accepters, 3},
 1135: 					{mfa, {ssl_test_lib, send_recv_result_active, []}},
 1136: 					{options, ServerOpts}]),
 1137:     Port = ssl_test_lib:inet_port(Server0),
 1138:     [Server1, Server2] = ssl_test_lib:accepters(2),
 1139: 
 1140:     Client0 = ssl_test_lib:start_client([{node, ClientNode}, {port, Port},
 1141: 					 {host, Hostname},
 1142: 					 {from, self()},
 1143: 					 {mfa, {ssl_test_lib, send_recv_result_active, []}},
 1144: 					 {options, ClientOpts}
 1145: 					]),
 1146: 
 1147:     Client1 = ssl_test_lib:start_client([{node, ClientNode}, {port, Port},
 1148: 					 {host, Hostname},
 1149: 					 {from, self()},
 1150: 					 {mfa, {ssl_test_lib, send_recv_result_active, []}},
 1151: 					 {options, ClientOpts}
 1152: 					]),
 1153: 
 1154:     Client2 = ssl_test_lib:start_client([{node, ClientNode}, {port, Port},
 1155: 					 {host, Hostname},
 1156: 					 {from, self()},
 1157: 					 {mfa, {ssl_test_lib, send_recv_result_active, []}},
 1158: 					 {options, ClientOpts}
 1159: 					]),
 1160: 
 1161:     ssl_test_lib:check_ok([Server0, Server1, Server2, Client0, Client1, Client2]),
 1162: 
 1163:     ssl_test_lib:close(Server0),
 1164:     ssl_test_lib:close(Server1),
 1165:     ssl_test_lib:close(Server2),
 1166:     ssl_test_lib:close(Client0),
 1167:     ssl_test_lib:close(Client1),
 1168:     ssl_test_lib:close(Client2).
 1169:

 1209: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
 1210: tls_password_correct() ->
 1211:     [{doc, "Test that connection is possible with a correct password"}].
 1212: tls_password_correct(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1213:     F = fun (P) ->
 1214:                 ProtectedClientOpts = ?config(client_protected_rsa_opts, Config),
 1215:                 ServerOpts = ssl_test_lib:ssl_options(server_rsa_opts, Config),
 1216: 
 1217:                 {ClientNode, ServerNode, Hostname} = ssl_test_lib:run_where(Config),
 1218:                 Server = ssl_test_lib:start_server([{node, ServerNode}, {port, 0},
 1219:                                                     {from, self()},
 1220:                                                     {mfa, {ssl_test_lib, send_recv_result, []}},
 1221:                                                     {options, [{active, false} | ServerOpts]}]),
 1222:                 Port = ssl_test_lib:inet_port(Server),
 1223:                 Client = ssl_test_lib:start_client([{node, ClientNode}, {port, Port},
 1224:                                                     {host, Hostname},
 1225:                                                     {from, self()},
 1226:                                                     {mfa,
 1227:                                                      {ssl_test_lib, send_recv_result, []}},
 1228:                                                     {options,
 1229:                                                      [{verify, verify_none},
 1230:                                                       {active, false},
 1231:                                                       {password, P} | ProtectedClientOpts]}]),
 1232:                 ssl_test_lib:check_result(Server, ok, Client, ok),
 1233:                 ssl_test_lib:close(Server),
 1234:                 ssl_test_lib:close(Client)
 1235:         end,
 1236:     F(?CORRECT_PASSWORD),
 1237:     F(fun() -> ?CORRECT_PASSWORD end).
 1238: 
 1239: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
 1240: tls_password_incorrect() ->
 1241:     [{doc, "Test that connection is not possible with wrong password"}].
 1242: tls_password_incorrect(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1243:     F = fun (P) ->
 1244:                 ProtectedClientOpts = ?config(client_protected_rsa_opts, Config),
 1245:                 ServerOpts = ssl_test_lib:ssl_options(server_rsa_opts, Config),
 1246: 
 1247:                 {ClientNode, ServerNode, Hostname} = ssl_test_lib:run_where(Config),
 1248:                 Server = ssl_test_lib:start_server_error([{node, ServerNode}, {port, 0},
 1249:                                                           {from, self()},
 1250:                                                           {mfa, ssl_test_lib, no_result},
 1251:                                                           {options, [{active, false} | ServerOpts]}]),
 1252:                 Port = ssl_test_lib:inet_port(Server),
 1253:                 Client = ssl_test_lib:start_client_error([{node, ClientNode}, {port, Port},
 1254:                                                           {host, Hostname},
 1255:                                                           {from, self()},
 1256:                                                           {mfa, ssl_test_lib, no_result},
 1257:                                                           {options,
 1258:                                                            [{active, false},
 1259:                                                             {verify, verify_none},
 1260:                                                             {password, P} | ProtectedClientOpts]}]),
 1261:                 Results = ssl_test_lib:get_result([Server, Client]),
 1262:                 Pred = fun({Pid, {error, closed}}) ->
 1263:                                Server == Pid;
 1264:                           ({Pid, {error, {options, {keyfile, _, {error, _}}}}}) ->
 1265:                                Client == Pid;
 1266:                           (_) -> false
 1267:                        end,
 1268:                 true = lists:all(Pred, Results)
 1269:         end,
 1270:     F(?INCORRECT_PASSWORD),
 1271:     F(fun() -> ?INCORRECT_PASSWORD end).
 1272: 
 1273: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
 1274: tls_password_badarg() ->
 1275:     [{doc, "Test that connection is not possible with badarg password"}].
 1276: tls_password_badarg(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1277:     F = fun (P, ServerError, ClientError) ->
 1278:                 ProtectedClientOpts = ?config(client_protected_rsa_opts, Config),
 1279:                 ServerOpts = ssl_test_lib:ssl_options(server_rsa_opts, Config),
 1280:                 {ClientNode, ServerNode, Hostname} = ssl_test_lib:run_where(Config),
 1281:                 Server = ssl_test_lib:start_server_error([{node, ServerNode}, {port, 0},
 1282:                                                           {from, self()},
 1283:                                                           {mfa, ssl_test_lib, no_result},
 1284:                                                           {timeout, 100},
 1285:                                                           {options, [{active, false} | ServerOpts]}]),
 1286:                 Port = ssl_test_lib:inet_port(Server),
 1287:                 Client = ssl_test_lib:start_client_error([{node, ClientNode}, {port, Port},
 1288:                                                           {host, Hostname},
 1289:                                                           {from, self()},
 1290:                                                           {mfa, ssl_test_lib, no_result},
 1291:                                                           {options,
 1292:                                                            [{active, false},
 1293:                                                             {verify, verify_none},
 1294:                                                             {password, P} | ProtectedClientOpts]}]),
 1295:                 ssl_test_lib:check_result(Server, ServerError, Client, ClientError)
 1296:         end,
 1297:     %% {options error comes from ssl app
 1298:     F(?BADARG_PASSWORD, {error, timeout},
 1299:       {error, {options, {password, ?BADARG_PASSWORD}}}),
 1300:     %% {keyfile, badarg} error comes from crypto:macN, also handhsake is initiated
 1301:     %% so different server error is observed
 1302:     F(fun() -> ?BADARG_PASSWORD end, {error, closed},
 1303:       {error, {keyfile,badarg}}).
 1304: 
 1305: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
 1306: signature_algs() ->
 1307:     [{doc, "Check that listing of signature algorithms for different version and configure combinations"}].
 1308: signature_algs(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1309:     true = [] =/= [Alg || Alg <- ssl:signature_algs(default, 'tlsv1.3'), is_tuple(Alg)],
 1310:     true = [] == [Alg || Alg <- ssl:signature_algs(exclusive, 'tlsv1.3'), is_tuple(Alg)],
 1311:     true = ssl:signature_algs(exclusive, 'tlsv1.3') =/=  ssl:signature_algs(exclusive, 'tlsv1.2'),
 1312:     true = length(ssl:signature_algs(defalt, 'tlsv1.2')) <
 1313:         length(ssl:signature_algs(all, 'tlsv1.2')),
 1314:     TLS_1_3_All = ssl:signature_algs(all, 'tlsv1.3'),
 1315:     true = lists:member(rsa_pkcs1_sha512, TLS_1_3_All) andalso (not lists:member({sha512, rsa}, TLS_1_3_All)),
 1316:     true = lists:member(rsa_pkcs1_sha384, TLS_1_3_All) andalso (not lists:member({sha384, rsa}, TLS_1_3_All)),
 1317:     true = lists:member(rsa_pkcs1_sha256, TLS_1_3_All) andalso (not lists:member({sha256, rsa}, TLS_1_3_All)),
 1318:     TLS_1_2_All = ssl:signature_algs(all, 'tlsv1.2'),
 1319:     true = (not lists:member(rsa_pkcs1_sha512, TLS_1_2_All)) andalso lists:member({sha512, rsa}, TLS_1_2_All),
 1320:     true = (not lists:member(rsa_pkcs1_sha384, TLS_1_2_All)) andalso lists:member({sha384, rsa}, TLS_1_2_All),
 1321:     true = (not lists:member(rsa_pkcs1_sha256, TLS_1_2_All)) andalso lists:member({sha256, rsa}, TLS_1_2_All).
 1322: 
 1323: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
 1324: %% Internal functions ------------------------------------------------
 1325: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
 1326: 
 1327: upgrade_result(Socket) ->
 1328:     ssl:setopts(Socket, [{active, true}]),
 1329:     ok = ssl:send(Socket, "Hello world"),
 1330:     %% Make sure binary is inherited from tcp socket and that we do
 1331:     %% not get the list default!
 1332:     <<"Hello world">> =  ssl_test_lib:active_recv(Socket, length("Hello world")),
 1333:     ok.
 1334: 
 1335: upgrade_result_new_opts(Socket) ->
 1336:     ssl:setopts(Socket, [{active, true}]),
 1337:     ok = ssl:send(Socket, "Hello world"),
 1338:     %% Make sure list option set in ssl:connect/handshake overrides
 1339:     %% previous gen_tcp socket option that was set to binary.
 1340:     "Hello world" =  ssl_test_lib:active_recv(Socket, length("Hello world")),
 1341:     ok.
 1342: 
 1343: tls_downgrade_result(Socket, Pid) ->
 1344:     ok = ssl_test_lib:send_recv_result(Socket),
 1345:     Pid ! {self(), ready},
 1346:     receive
 1347:         go ->
 1348:             ok
 1349:     end,
 1350:     case ssl:close(Socket, {self(), 10000})  of
 1351: 	{ok, TCPSocket} ->
 1352:             inet:setopts(TCPSocket, [{active, true}]),
 1353: 	    gen_tcp:send(TCPSocket, "Downgraded"),
 1354:             <<"Downgraded">> = active_tcp_recv(TCPSocket, length("Downgraded")),
 1355:             ok;
 1356: 	{ok, TCPSocket, Bin} ->
 1357: 	    gen_tcp:send(TCPSocket, "Downgraded"),
 1358:             <<"Downgraded">> = Bin,
 1359:             ok;
 1360: 	{error, timeout} ->
 1361: 	    ct:comment("Timed out, downgrade aborted"),
 1362: 	    ok;
 1363: 	Fail ->
 1364:             ct:fail(Fail)
 1365:     end.
 1366: 
 1367: tls_shutdown_result(Socket, server) ->
 1368:     ok = ssl:send(Socket, "Hej"),
 1369:     ok = ssl:shutdown(Socket, write),
 1370:     {ok, "Hej hopp"} = ssl:recv(Socket, 8),
 1371:     ok;
 1372: 
 1373: tls_shutdown_result(Socket, client) ->
 1374:     ok = ssl:send(Socket, "Hej hopp"),
 1375:     ok = ssl:shutdown(Socket, write),
 1376:     {ok, "Hej"} = ssl:recv(Socket, 3),
 1377:     ok.
 1378: 
 1379: tls_shutdown_write_result(Socket, server) ->
 1380:     ct:sleep(?SLEEP),
 1381:     ssl:shutdown(Socket, write);
 1382: tls_shutdown_write_result(Socket, client) ->
 1383:     ssl:recv(Socket, 0).
 1384: 
 1385: tls_shutdown_both_result(Socket, server) ->
 1386:     ct:sleep(?SLEEP),
 1387:     ssl:shutdown(Socket, read_write);
 1388: tls_shutdown_both_result(Socket, client) ->
 1389:     ssl:recv(Socket, 0).
 1390: 
 1391: tls_closed_in_active_once_loop(Socket) ->
 1392:     case ssl:setopts(Socket, [{active, once}]) of
 1393:         ok ->
 1394:             receive
 1395:                 {ssl, Socket, _} ->
 1396:                     tls_closed_in_active_once_loop(Socket);
 1397:                 {ssl_closed, Socket} ->
 1398:                     ok
 1399:             end;
 1400:         {error, closed} ->
 1401:             {error, ssl_setopt_failed}
 1402:     end.
 1403: 
 1404: receive_msg(_) ->
 1405:     receive
 1406: 	Msg ->
 1407: 	   Msg
 1408:     end.
 1409: 
 1410: tls_socket_options_result(Socket, Options, DefaultValues, NewOptions, NewValues) ->
 1411:     %% Test get/set emulated opts
 1412:     {ok, DefaultValues} = ssl:getopts(Socket, Options),
 1413:     ssl:setopts(Socket, NewValues),
 1414:     {ok, NewValues} = ssl:getopts(Socket, NewOptions),
 1415:     %% Test get/set inet opts
 1416:     {ok,[{nodelay,false}]} = ssl:getopts(Socket, [nodelay]),
 1417:     ssl:setopts(Socket, [{nodelay, true}]),
 1418:     {ok,[{nodelay, true}]} = ssl:getopts(Socket, [nodelay]),
 1419:     {ok, All} = ssl:getopts(Socket, []),
 1420:     ?CT_LOG("All opts ~p~n", [All]),
 1421:     ok.
 1422: 
 1423: active_tcp_recv(Socket, N) ->
 1424:     active_tcp_recv(Socket, N, []).
 1425: 
 1426: active_tcp_recv(_Socket, 0, Acc) ->
 1427:     Acc;
 1428: active_tcp_recv(Socket, N, Acc) ->
 1429:     receive
 1430: 	{tcp, Socket, Bytes} ->
 1431:             active_tcp_recv(Socket, N-size(Bytes),  Acc ++ Bytes)
 1432:     end.
 1433: 
 1434: tls_monitor_listen_opts('tlsv1.3', Opts) ->
 1435:     [{session_tickets, stateful} | Opts];
 1436: tls_monitor_listen_opts(_, Opts) ->
 1437:     Opts.
 1438: 
 1439: tls_monitor_client_opts('tlsv1.3', Opts) ->
 1440:     [{session_tickets, auto} | Opts];
 1441: tls_monitor_client_opts(_, Opts) ->
 1442:     Opts.
 1443: 
 1444: session_info('tlsv1.3') ->
 1445:     count_children(workers, tls_server_session_ticket_sup);
 1446: session_info(_) ->
 1447:     count_children(workers, ssl_server_session_cache_sup).
 1448: 
 1449: count_children(ChildType, SupRef) ->
 1450:     proplists:get_value(ChildType, supervisor:count_children(SupRef)).
 1451: 
 1452: 
 1453: new_versions('tlsv1.3') ->
 1454:     ['tlsv1.2'];
 1455: new_versions('tlsv1.2') ->
 1456:     ['tlsv1.1'];
 1457: new_versions('tlsv1.1') ->
 1458:     ['tlsv1'];
 1459: new_versions('tlsv1') ->
 1460:     ['tlsv1'].
